ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! When it reaches the gullet
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Never so, for when life withdraws into the clavicula,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Nay; when a man's soul reaches up to the throat,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Some people, certainly, do not believe in it, but when a person's soul reaches up to his throat
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Yes indeed, when the soul will reach up to the throat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay, when it rea- ches to the collarbones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! When it comes up to the throat,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; when it reaches the clavicles
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but when the life cometh up to the throat
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But when [man's soul] reaches the throat,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! When it cometh up to he collar-bone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! When it reaches up to the collar bones
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Yea, when (the soul) reaches to the collar-bone (in its exit),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, when (the soul) reaches to the collar bone (i.e. up to the throat in its exit),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But, when (the soul) reaches the collar bone
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Indeed, when it has reached the breast-bones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! When the soul has reached the collar bones
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:26] No indeed! (kallā: in the sense of alā) When it, the soul, reaches up to the collar bones,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay) truly, (but when the life cometh up to the throat) when the soul of the body reaches the throat
